Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2008 05:35PM sueUK wrote: Hi Mom2two! Im so sorry to hear about your discomfort...I was the same, and used that expression - it feels like someone is sandpapering an open wound! I am now just over 4 months out of a mastectomy & lymph node dissection - I would say it took at least 2 months before my wound felt comfortable enough to massage - prior to that it was a horrible feeling and felt way too tender. The sydrome pain I get is mostly in my underarm down to the elbow, and my shoulder blade - it didnt let up for me and my doctor prescribed gabapentin about a month ago. This has helped enormously and even driving is comfy now where it was unbearable before! It is still a big relief to get all my clothes off at night though and pop on my cosy pj's! I wish you a speedy recovery Mom2two! Sue x
